intro: Scleranthus arrectifolius, commonly known as the upright-leaved sand-plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant has erect, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters at the ends of the branches. It is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments.
